Was this game related to The Illusion of Gaia, like a prequel or a sequel?
I mean both games were developed by Enix and have a kind of similar plot.

Was this game related to The Illusion of Gaia, like a prequel or a sequel?

snippet.textDisplay: They were developed by quintet. Enix just published them.
snippet.textOriginal: They were developed by quintet. Enix just published them.

snippet.textDisplay: @Owari Dragon They are part of the same "Gaia" trilogy. The first being "Soul Blazer", second being "Illusion of Gaia", and the third being Terranigma.
snippet.textOriginal: @Owari Dragon They are part of the same "Gaia" trilogy. The first being "Soul Blazer", second being "Illusion of Gaia", and the third being Terranigma.

snippet.textDisplay:
@MrRizo23 Greetings from the future!
Terranigma was composed by Miyoko Takaoka and Masanori Hikichi. Masanori Hikichi didn't do much beyond Terranigma, but Miyoko Takaoka seems to be the main composer for the Atelier and Langrisser series.
snippet.textOriginal:
@MrRizo23 Greetings from the future!
Terranigma was composed by Miyoko Takaoka and Masanori Hikichi. Masanori Hikichi didn't do much beyond Terranigma, but Miyoko Takaoka seems to be the main composer for the Atelier and Langrisser series.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well, it helps if you realize that the universe of the Soul Blazer series is broken up into four perspectives: Gaia, Dark Gaia, the everyday people living in the world, and the spirits watching over everything.

So Soul Blazer is the universe from Gaia's perspective, Illusion of Gaia is the universe from the people's perspective, Terranigma is the universe from Dark Gaia's perspective, and The Granstream Saga is the universe from the spirits' perspective.
snippet.textOriginal:
Well, it helps if you realize that the universe of the Soul Blazer series is broken up into four perspectives: Gaia, Dark Gaia, the everyday people living in the world, and the spirits watching over everything.

So Soul Blazer is the universe from Gaia's perspective, Illusion of Gaia is the universe from the people's perspective, Terranigma is the universe from Dark Gaia's perspective, and The Granstream Saga is the universe from the spirits' perspective.

snippet.textDisplay:
This series of games (Soul Blazer, Illusion of Gaia, Terranigma, and The Granstream Saga) is probably the only one that gets me emotionally.

I'd pay good money to see these games turned into a manga or anime, with that same sorrowful, serene timbre kept in them.
snippet.textOriginal:
This series of games (Soul Blazer, Illusion of Gaia, Terranigma, and The Granstream Saga) is probably the only one that gets me emotionally.

I'd pay good money to see these games turned into a manga or anime, with that same sorrowful, serene timbre kept in them.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't understand why this was only released in Europe?!  I first played this as ROM.  I got stuck at one point where I had to cross a river with no bridge going across it. I couldn't figure out how to get across. :(  The music and graphics were top notch.  This tune right here is very nice and peaceful.  Another good choice! ;)
